WRITING.TITLE: Bol.com or book depository
WRITING.TEXT:
I've been buying manga from book depository for a long time now. I wanna buy the Dragon ball/DBZ Vizbig editions, but the price is the same on Bol.com (for the dutch manga collectors, here's a question): are the manga from bol.com new or do they use old ones? (I mean like i've heard they use old books from people who returned their broken down old manga and sell them as new) so should i use bol.com for my Vizbig editions or book depository?
Btw: (i wanna use bol.com ONLY for my vizbig/omni bus and box set's because they have the same price and i won't have to wait for the shipping from book depository lol, the normal manga from book depository are like 5-8 euro's while bol.com is like 10-12 euro's, but the omnibus/vizbig and box set's stay the same price. book depository is cheaper (and brand new quality) for buying single volume manga's)

Well some new beginners (like me) (i know other people too, see it on reddit, youtube, etc) they intend to throttle when they pull the front brake, like they pull the trottle while using the front brake, and that's so annoying. People say use the clutch for that, other people say you should you learn to not do that because if you use the clutch it gives you less stopping power. Because you could use the engine braking
So what should i exactly do now? Brake without or with (god dang it, one guy says yes the other says no, i need some professional to tell me xd)

Well, i also saw that the engine actually doesn't add up extra braking power, they say it's better to use the clutch while braking because it has no difference in stopping power, only that it keeps you safe from accidently throttling while using the front brake

WRITING.TITLE: Counter steering
WRITING.TEXT: Well i know about counter steering, i do it myself. But my question was someone who doesn't know what counter steering is and rides a motorcycle, let's say he goes at a fast speed, counter steering happens on it's own right? Because let's say you are in the right lane and you wanna turn left, you need to push left to go left. So there's no possible way to steer to the left otherwise it would go to the right? Right?
Nice name lol

With msf i just meant (motorcycle riding school or however you wanna call it in english) and yes when you're 16 you can ride max of 50cc, 17 125cc (11 kW), 35 kW when you're 20-23, and also at the age of 22-24 you can get a A licence so you can ride a motorcycle with whatever power you want.
So basically: A1 licence: 11kw/125cc (17/18-19 age) A2 licence: 35kw (20-23 age) A licence: whatever power you want. (22-24 age)
